pageContext.description: There is no beveling or midrib on this blade - more like a piece of sheet copper.  Three rivet holes,  2 large + 1 small.  lightly bent.
pageContext.other: Contains a hand drawn 2-dimensional image showing general oval-tripod shape with hole locations on the base.  Base of image is to the left, with the more pointed end (top) to the right as shown.
pageContext.publications: Prehistoric Bronze 119.  No catalogue,  Bronze 14.  The numbers can be found in a cataglogue called "Museum of Archaeology",  Cambridge Antiquarian Society catalogue 170. 1884,
pageContext.rightCorner: Collection:,  Museum of Archaeology. Cambridge,  probably from the late Dr. wellis Collections 1854
pageContext.collection: Museum of Archaeology.  Cambridge,  probably from the late Dr. Wellis collection 1854.
